Visa information for Greece

There are different types of Visas for different requirements depending on the purpose of your travel to Greece. The visa type depends on the purpose of visits, such as work, study, tourism, etc. Based on your requirement you have to apply for a different Greece Schengen Visa. It is important to apply for a Greece Schengen Visa since Greece has been a member of the European Union since 2000, thereby becoming the member state of the Schengen Area.

a) Greece Tourist/ Visitor Visa :

⮚ Invitation letter from friends or family members with their address and phone number- if applicable

⮚ Declaration form if travelling without any invitation from friends or family

⮚ Bank statement of the last 6 months

⮚ Passport copies

⮚ Travel insurance for Greece visa

b) Greece Visa for Business Purpose :

⮚ Invitation letter from Greek company stating that you will be visiting the country for business purposes

⮚ A certificate from your employer stating/ allowing the business travel

⮚ Business bank statement for the last 6 months

⮚ Memorandum and Article of Association in original certified copy (registered with joint-stock companies) Trade License (first issued and present renewal), Proprietorship/Partnership documents

⮚ Either the employer or the partner company must state coverage of expenses during the stay of the applicant

⮚ Valid travel insurance for Greece to be provided either by the employer or the partner company

c) Greece Visa for Medical purpose :

⮚ A local medical report stating the condition of the applicant

⮚ Medical attestation from the treating doctor or hospital in Greece, confirming the date of your appointment as well as your medical situation

⮚ Payment receipt of medical fees

⮚ Valid travel insurance for Greece from India

d) Greece visa for Cultural, Sports, Film Crew & Religious purposes :

⮚ An invitation letter from the above-mentioned authorities stating the nature of events or activities- the purpose of visit, expense coverage etc

⮚ Duration of stay

⮚ Travel itinerary

⮚ Travel insurance Greece policy

e) Greece Visa for Study, Training or Research :

⮚ An enrolment certificate from the college or research institute allowing attendance of courses

⮚ Financial sustenance proof

⮚ Student travel health insurance Greece

f) Greece visa for Spouse of Greek Citizen :

⮚ Proof of Greek citizenship

⮚ Marriage certificate

⮚ Greek family record book

⮚ Travel insurance for Greece from India

Process of application for a Greece Visa:

Step 1- Decide on the Visa type: The first step is to decide which type of Greece Schengen visa is required, depending on the purpose of visit, length of trip etc. The standard Schengen visa for trips lasting less than 90 days is a short-stay visa, with longer stays required for a Work, Study or family reunion visa.

Step 2- Fill the application form: The next step in the Greece Schengen visa is to fill the application form online from the Greece government website and pay a fee of €80 for adults and €40 for minors and proceed to slot booking for visa interview. You must apply for your visa no less than 6 months and no fewer than 15 days before your trip.

Step 3- Book the slot & attend interview: After the application form is filled the applicant should book the slot for visa interview on any of the available dates shown and attend the visa interview with all the necessary documents. One of the necessary documents required is Travel insurance for a Greece visa which should be produced at the time of the visa interview.

Step 4 – Track the status: The status of your visa application can be tracked online here on the website of the Greece government. Communication will be sent to the applicant once the visa is approved by the Embassy.

Documents Required By Indian Nationals applying For a Greece Visa

Indian citizens travelling to Greece from India need to submit the below requirements before applying for a Greece visa:

⮚ A printout of the Greece Visa application form with signature

⮚ Two recent passport size photographs as per the Schengen Visa photograph requirements

⮚ A minimum coverage of at least 30k EUR or $50k travel insurance for Greece. Travel insurance for Greece visa as mentioned above from Tata AIG travel insurance

⮚ Visa depending on the type of requirement – Work, Visit, Study etc

⮚ Indian passport valid for at least three months from the intended date of entry into Greece

⮚ Proof of sufficient funds for the duration of stay in Greece

⮚ Adherence to the local laws and European Union transit rules

⮚ Proof of your accommodation in Greece; if there are more than 1 accommodations then the accommodation in the first 24 hours should be mentioned

⮚ Proof of payment of visa fees

Your Schengen Visa Fee is based on the visa type you apply for and the planned duration of your stay in Greece. A Short-stay Schengen Visa costs €80 for Indian nationals over the age of 18 years and €40 for Indian nationals between 6 and 12 years of age. There is no visa fee for Indian children below the age of 6 years.

Greece is the city of an ancient civilization where there were many war heroes and there are hundreds of stories about their valour. But now there remain only the memories of the past in the form of ancient cities like Athens and Rhodes which are the must-visit places in Greece. There are many places which are known for their beauty such as mountains, beaches, hills etc.

Athens:

Athens is the capital of Greece and is also the oldest inhabited and largest city in the world. The city traces back to the 5th century and is one of the oldest inhabited places with people living for more than 7 centuries. The city has many landmarks such as the Acropolis, a hilltop citadel topped with ancient buildings like the Parthenon temple which is one of the most visited places in Athens. Acropolis museum of Athens has many national sculptures, jewellery dating back to the Greek civilization. The city has good food and music which attracts tourists from all over the World.

Santorini:

Santorini is one of the many islands in the Aegean Sea which is the most famous place to visit in Greece which is about 200km from the capital city Athens. The city was known as Thira or Thera during the Greek period and traces back to the Bronze age. The city has many dome-shaped houses which are painted a beautiful blue.

Since the city is in close proximity to Sea, it is famous for its views and soothing atmosphere. It is believed that thousands of years ago there was a volcanic eruption that caused the Strongili to sink leaving the crater. Santorini is famous for its crisp dry, desert wines known as Visanto. The wines are made from the locally available grape variety, assyrtiko.

Zakynthos:

Zakynthos is one of the well-known islands in Greece which is used as a Summer resort by many tourists. The city is located in the centre of the Ionian Sea is a centre of attraction with hilltop villages and other natural landscapes. Zakynthos also known as the flower of the East is believed to be inhabited since 1500BC and is still the oldest inhabited city in the World. The city has many beaches such as Laganas Zanga, Greakas beach, Vasilikos beach and Spiantza beach. The beaches are the breeding hubs for Caretta sea turtles which are on the list of most endangered species.

Delphi:

Delphi is one of the ancient cities in Greece. It is the place of the important Greek temple Apollo. Delphi has been recognised as an archaeology site by the UNESCO and steps are being taken by the Greece government to protect the national heritage monument. Ancient Greeks considered the Delphi city as the centre of the World. There is a new city which is constructed adjacent to the old city with the same name and the site is a major tourist attraction in Greece.

The best time to visit Greece is during spring (April to early –June) and autumn (September-October). A visit to Greece during this period guarantees mild weather which can be enjoyed and fewer crowds during these seasons. This season the crowd would be less thereby providing you with the space to enjoy the length and breadth of the country without much restriction on your budget.

Visiting Greece during these seasons also saves you a bit of money as the demand for hotels and other places would be less during these seasons. Most of the tourists descend on the small island from May to September to enjoy the full nature of Greece.
